page.title: 04 THE OLD MILL.
page.content: One hundred and forty-five years ago{Heighington Mill}was beginning to develop. Mr. Curtis owned the mill and was responsible for its production. The twenty people who worked there were responsible for grinding the corn and making sure the water wheel was working. Sadly the wheel has now gone but the mill still remains. Mr.Flavell now lives inside it with his family and his antique shop which is built on the front. When the mill was built it only had three storeys, but when Mr. Flavell bought it he added an antique shop and another storey to the mill The mill stopped production about fifteen years ago.Twenty people worked in the mill and only four of them were women.
